triplets: Human-powered vehicle with two wheels, used for personal transportation, exercise, and recreation
Commuting, leisure rides, sport cycling, exercise, and competitive racing
Frame typically made of steel, aluminum, carbon fiber, or titanium; tires made of rubber; components include metal and plastic
Frame providing structural support and holding all components together
Wheels, including rims, spokes, tires, and hubs for mobility
Varies widely depending on manufacturer and model; common colors include black, red, blue, and metallic finishes
Personal transportation, recreational equipment, sports equipment, and fitness activities
Various manufacturers producing road bikes, mountain bikes, hybrid bikes, and specialty bicycles
Typically 10–25 kg depending on frame material, size, and accessories
Approximately 1–1.2 meters from seat to ground; overall dimensions vary by type
Typically 5–15 years depending on quality, frequency of use, and maintenance
